meanings.definition: Unable to be imitated or copied; unique.
meanings.sent1: Her inimitable style of painting made her stand out from the other artists.
meanings.sent2: The singer's voice was truly inimitable, unlike any other.
meanings.sent3: Even the most talented artists found her inimitable technique challenging to replicate.
meanings.sent4: His inimitable charm captured the hearts of everyone he met.
meanings.sent5: The inimitable beauty of the sunset left us all speechless.

meanings.sent1: The team's inimitable performance secured their victory in the championship.
meanings.sent2: The view from the mountaintop was truly inimitable, offering a breathtaking panorama.
meanings.sent3: His inimitable sense of humor always brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: The inimitable bond between the siblings was evident in their unwavering support for each other.
meanings.sent5: The inimitable taste of her homemade apple pie was a hit at the bake sale.
